column3: Perhaps you could also do a similar replacement for pruning.py, which uses this same duplicated mine_full_block() function?
A couple of nits, otherwise ACK

@MarcoFalke @sdaftuar @mrbandrews Did you test this?
It seems to have slowed pruning.py by 35%.  I don't think its worth it at the expense of adding 10 mins to the pruning.py test.
Jup, I was running the tests after squash. Will take a look at the\nslowdown. Should be easy to fix if this commit caused it.\n
@marcofalke my guess is it's the repeated calling of listunspent instead of caching the utxo's.  well I should say that's the first difference I saw and then was too tired to investigate further.
nit: think you left this in accidentally
